segment.tokens: From an authentic source I have obtained an incident of recent occurrence
an incident of recent occurrence painfully illustrates the fury of the wolf
an incident of recent occurrence while engaged at a favorite meal
Near Lake Constance in Canada two men observed
some wolves engaged eating a deer
named Black
One of them went to dispute the prize with these ravenous animals , when he unfortunately fell a victim to his rashness , the wolves having devoured him , leaving only a small portion of his bones
when he unfortunately fell a victim to his rashness
the wolves having devoured him
leaving only a small portion of his bones
Some three years since while traveling in Canada I met a lady
a lady resided with a brother in the employ of the Hudson 's Bay Company , a few hundred miles north of Montreal
This lady informed me
that she had not unfrequently been chased wolves
she while proceeding to the house of her nearest neighbor -- about ten miles distant --
that a pack of them unusually hungry once seemed very much determined to pull her from her horse
though they finally made up their minds
that they would try their fortunes in another direction
It sometimes though not very frequently happens
that several wolves together attack men
men travel on horseback
men fight furiously
A story is told of two men who were traveling in this manner in Mexico
two men were traveling in this manner in Mexico
one would suppose
two three wolves had fasted a good while
when two three wolves fell upon the men and their horses
it was a of some doubt for a time , who would be the victors , the travelers or their assailants
a time would be the the travelers their assailants
The former were armed with pistols too
The wolves got the worst of the battle however at last
they retreated
as men very often do
when they go to war with each other
having gained nothing but a broken limb two
a broken limb two they boast of for the remainder of their lives
A peasant in Russia was one
riding along
when he found
that he was pursued eleven wolves
he urged his horse to the very extent of his speed
was a
being shut at the time
At the entrance to his residence was a gate , which being shut at the time the frightened horse dashed open
the frightened horse carried his master safely into the yard
Nine of the wolves followed the man his horse into the inclosure , when fortunately , the gate swung back
the inclosure when fortunately the gate swung back
Nine of the wolves caught them all
as it were in a trap
Finding
themselves caught in this manner
the wolves seemed to lose all their courage ferocity
They shrunk away
They tried to hide themselves pursuing their prey
they were all killed with very little difficulty
The following story of an encounter with a saucy wolf in the south-western part of the United States is taken from the journal of a Santa Fe trader "
I shall not soon forget an adventure with a furious wolf many years ago on the frontiers of Missouri
Riding near the prairie border
I perceived one of the largest and fiercest of the gray species , which had just descended from the west
the gray species had just descended from the west
I seemed famished to desperation
I at once prepared for a chase
being without arms
I caught up a cudgel
when I betook me valiantly to the charge much stronger
as I soon discovered in my cause than in my equipment
The wolf was in no humor to flee however
boldly met me full half way
I was soon disarmed for
my club broke upon the animal 's head
He then laid to my horse legs
my horse legs not relishing the conflict gave a plunge
my horse legs sent me
whirling over his head
my horse legs made his escape
my horse legs leaving me the wolf at close quarters
I was no sooner upon my feet
than my antagonist renewed the charge
save through his imagination
I took off my large black hat
being without a weapon , or any means awakening an emotion of terror using it for a shield began to thrust it toward his gaping jaws
My _ ruse _ had the effect
desired
for after springing at me a few times he wheeled about
he trotted off several paces
he stopped to gaze at me
that he might change his mind
he return to the attack
he conscious
that under the compromise I had the best of the bargain
I very resolutely took to my heels glad of the opportunity of making a drawn game , [ 1 ] though I had myself given the challenge "
though I had myself given the challenge
A friend of mine visited Texas a little while ago
A friend of mine gives quite an interesting account of a ride he had through an uninhabited part of that country , where wolves were abundant
he had through an uninhabited part of that country , where wolves were abundant
where wolves were
He says
As there was no road
" I was obliged to take the prairie
My conveyance was a
is by the way the for a long journey in this country
as it is far more of endurance than a horse
When I had rode about five miles
I found
that I had lost my course
as the sun was clouded
I had no means guessing at the route
I pushed on soon
found myself in a dense grove of live oak
Here I heard a distinct barking
I thought
I must be near a house
I rode toward the place whence the noise seemed to proceed
the noise seemed to proceed
I soon found
that I had committed a most egregious error
for I was in the very midst of a pack of wolves
consisting of about a dozen
As you may suppose
I was terribly
though I had heard
that wolves in the country seldom molest any one
traveling on horseback
Still this interesting party appeared singularly fierce hungry
I opened a large clasp knife the only available weapon in order to be prepared for the contemplated attack
I had
In this way I rode on about a mile with the wolves after me
when the whole force quietly dispersed
riding about three hours more I discovered
that I had been on the wrong track all the
though I was not
where I was
it was so
it was not to go further
So I spread my cloak on the grass thus prepared
tied my mule thus prepared
up to a tree
made my saddle into a pillow
lay down for the night
I thought of wolves "
I snakes for some time
I soon went to sleep
